subject: AI & Agents
title: What Is a Language Model?
description: A 60-second lesson on What Is a Language Model?.

hook.text: You type 'The cat sat on the' and AI predicts 'mat.' That prediction IS the language model.

buildup.text: A language model assigns probabilities to sequences of words based on training data.

discovery.text: Given context, it ranks every possible next word â€” 'mat' scores high, 'elephant' scores low.

twist.text: LLMs don't understand meaning. They model statistical relationships between tokens.

climax.text: Yet from pure statistics, they produce essays, code, poems, and conversations.

punchline.text: Predict the next word well enough, and intelligence emerges.

quiz.question: What does a language model fundamentally do?
options: Understands the meaning of every sentence
Stores a copy of the entire internet
